title.narrative: Enhancing ICTs for sustainable development policies, with a focus on teacher's education and youth empowerment to prevent violence

description.narrative: Next year, the oldest public programme of ICT for Education in Latin America will celebrate 30 years. Today, almost every country in the region has a robust policy in this field. However, many new challenges arose in these three decades. They could be summarized in the need for a new approach in the policies related to ICT for education, which should go beyond instrumental use and include a perspective of content curation and content production and empowerment of young populations in interacting with knowledge societies digital environments. This workplan aims to build on existing and forthcoming UNESCO's tools on ICT for education, MIL and OER to assist member states in strengthening their policies of teacher's capacity building and youth empowerment with and about ICTs.
